decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Prior to the commencement of the development to which this permission relates a a Crossover application (including site survey) must be submitted to the relevant highway authority and demonstrate that the proposed crossing will not encroach into the tree protection area of the existing street tree and that there is a minimum of 4.8 metres depth between the house(including bay window) and the back of footway. Reason: In order to protect the amenities of the area and highway safety in accordance with policy DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy 2012 and the RBK Crossover Policy 2020.This condition must be a pre-commencement condition in order to be effective.

The previous application referance number in the application form is written as 21/0646/FUL, we don't have any record in our system with that reference. Our system shows 21/00646/FUL as the application number, please amend the whole application form with the correct reference of previous application or please confirm 21/00646/FUL  is the correct application number.

Archaeology: You are advised that the written scheme of investigation secured under condition 13 would need to be prepared and implemented by a suitably professionally accredited archaeological practice in accordance with Historic England's Guidelines for Archaeological Projects in Greater London. This condition is exempt from deemed discharge under schedule 6 of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management  Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
